It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, with leaves that are often folded or rolled into a pouch-like structure. These plants are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Desmocladus species are often shrubs or small perennial herbs, and they produce small, inconspicuous flowers. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
